p: The dry leaves of A. indica, A. daniellii, and C. anisata; the seeds of A. melegueta and D. cinerea; and the roots of E. giganteus were cut into small pieces and subjected to hydrodistillation using a Clevenger-type apparatus until no more oil was obtained. The essential oils obtained were dried using Na 2SO 4 and stored at −20 °C in vials sealed with teflon caps and protected from light before use. The oil yields were calculated on a dry weight basis (%, w/w).
